intro: Erythranthe androsacea, commonly known as the Androsace erythranthe, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to survive in arid and high-altitude environments. Erythranthe androsacea is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in alpine gardens.
